data.meta_description: Robert John Downey, Jr. portrayed Tony Stark/Iron Man in Iron Man, The Incredible Hulk, Iron Man 2, The Avengers, Iron Man 3, Avengers: Age of Ultron, Captain America: Civil War, Spider-Man: Homecoming, Avengers: Infinity War and Avengers: Endgame. He also portrayed an alternate Tony Stark/Iron...
data.text:
Robert John Downey, Jr. portrayed Tony Stark/Iron Man in Iron Man, The Incredible Hulk, Iron Man 2, The Avengers, Iron Man 3, Avengers: Age of Ultron, Captain America: Civil War, Spider-Man: Homecoming, Avengers: Infinity War and Avengers: Endgame.

He also portrayed an alternate Tony Stark/Iron Man in Avengers: Endgame.

He will portray Victor von Doom/Doctor Doom in both Avengers: Doomsday and Avengers: Secret Wars.[1]

He also portrayed an alternate Tony Stark/Iron Man in the corporate advertisement Watch the Game.

He voiced an alternate Tony Stark/Iron Man in Iron Man.

Archive footage of Robert Downey, Jr. from The Incredible Hulk was used in Marvel One-Shot: The Consultant.

Archive footage of Robert Downey, Jr. from The Avengers was used in the Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. episode Pilot and the Loki episode Glorious Purpose.

Archive footage of Robert Downey, Jr. from Avengers: Age of Ultron was used in the WandaVision episode The Series Finale.

Archive footage of Robert Downey, Jr. from Captain America: Civil War was used in Spider-Man: Far From Home.

Archive footage of Robert Downey, Jr. from Avengers: Endgame was used in the Loki episode Glorious Purpose.

He was interviewed for the documentary Marvel Studios: Assembling a Universe.

Awards[]

He was nominated for a Teen Choice Award for Choice Movie Actor: Action Adventure for his work on Iron Man.

He was nominated for a Scream Award for Best Superhero for his work on Iron Man.

He won a Scream Award for Best Science Fiction Actor for his work on Iron Man.

He was nominated for a People's Choice Award for Favorite Superhero for his work on Iron Man.

He was nominated for an MTV Movie Award for Best Male Performance for his work on Iron Man.

He was nominated for a Teen Choice Award for Choice Movie Actor: Sci-Fi for his work on Iron Man 2.

He was nominated for a Teen Choice Award for Choice Movie Dance for his work on Iron Man 2.

Together with Don Cheadle, he was nominated for a Teen Choice Award for Choice Movie Fight/Action Sequence for his work on Iron Man 2.

He won a Scream Award for Best Superhero for his work on Iron Man 2.

He was nominated for a Scream Award for Best Science Fiction Actor for his work on Iron Man 2.

He was nominated for a People's Choice Award for Favorite Movie Actor for his work on Iron Man 2.

He was nominated for a People's Choice Award for Favorite Action Star for his work on Iron Man 2.

Together with Don Cheadle, he was nominated for a People's Choice Award for Favorite On-Screen Team for his work on Iron Man 2.

He was nominated for a Kids' Choice Award for Favorite Butt Kicker for his work on Iron Man 2.

He was nominated for a MTV Movie & TV Award for Biggest Badass Star for his work on Iron Man 2.

He was nominated for a Saturn Award for Best Actor for his work on Iron Man 2.

He was nominated for a SFX Award for Best Actor for his work on Iron Man 2.

He was nominated for a Teen Choice Award for Choice Movie Actor – Sci-Fi/Fantasy for his work on The Avengers.

He was nominated for a Teen Choice Award for Choice Summer Movie Star – Male for his work on The Avengers.

He won a People's Choice Award for Favorite Movie Actor for his work on The Avengers.

He won a People's Choice Award for Favorite Movie Superhero for his work on The Avengers.

He was nominated for a People's Choice Award for Favorite Action Movie Star for his work on The Avengers.

He was nominated for a Critic's Choice Award for Best Actor in an Action Movie for his work on The Avengers.

He was nominated for a Nickelodeon Kids' Choice Award for Favorite Male Buttkicker for his work on The Avengers.

He was nominated for an Empire Award for Best Actor for his work on The Avengers.

Together with Mark Ruffalo, he won an MTV Movie Award for Best On-Screen Duo for his work on The Avengers.

Together with Chris Hemsworth, Chris Evans, Mark Ruffalo, Scarlett Johansson, Jeremy Renner and Tom Hiddleston, he won an MTV Movie Award for Best Fight for his work on The Avengers.

He was nominated for an MTV Movie Award for Best Hero for his work on The Avengers.

He won a Teen Choice Award for Choice Movie Actor: Action for his work on Iron Man 3.

He was nominated for a Teen Choice Award for Choice Movie Actor: Sci-Fi/Fantasy for his work on Iron Man 3.

Together with Gwyneth Paltrow, he was nominated for a People's Choice Award for Favorite Movie Duo for his work on Iron Man 3.

He won a People's Choice Award for Favorite Action Movie Star for his work on Iron Man 3.

He won a Kids' Choice Award for Favorite Male Buttkicker for his work on Iron Man 3.

He was nominated for a Kids' Choice Award for Favorite Movie Actor for his work on Iron Man 3.

He won a Saturn Award for Best Actor for his work on Iron Man 3.

He was nominated for a Teen Choice Award for Choice Movie Actor: Sci-Fi/Fantasy for his work on Avengers: Age of Ultron.

He was nominated for a People's Choice Awards for Favorite Action Movie Actor for his work on Avengers: Age of Ultron.

He was nominated for a People's Choice Awards for Favorite Movie Actor for his work on Avengers: Age of Ultron.

He was nominated for a Kids' Choice Award for Favorite Movie Actor for his work on Avengers: Age of Ultron.

Together with Mark Ruffalo, he was nominated for an MTV Movie Award for Best Fight for his work on Avengers: Age of Ultron.

He was nominated for a Teen Choice Award for Choice Movie Actor: Sci-Fi/Fantasy for his work on Captain America: Civil War.

Together with Scarlett Johansson, Don Cheadle, Paul Bettany, and Chadwick Boseman, he was nominated for a Teen Choice Award for Choice Movie: Chemistry for his work on Captain America: Civil War.

He was nominated for a People's Choice Award for Favorite Movie Actor for his work on Captain America: Civil War.

He won a People's Choice Award for Favorite Action Movie Actor for his work on Captain America: Civil War.

He was nominated for a Kids' Choice Award for Favorite Movie Actor for his work on Captain America: Civil War.

Together with Chris Evans, he was nominated for a Kids' Choice Award for Favorite Frenemies for his work on Captain America: Civil War.

Together with Chris Evans, Scarlett Johansson, Sebastian Stan, Anthony Mackie, Don Cheadle, Jeremy Renner, and Chadwick Boseman, he was he was nominated for a Kids' Choice Award for #SQUAD for his work on Captain America: Civil War.

He won a Teen Choice Award for Choice Action Movie Actor for his work on Avengers: Infinity War.

Trivia[]

Robert Downey, Jr. was previously considered for the role of Victor von Doom/Doctor Doom in the 20th Century Fox production Fantastic Four before the role went to Julian McMahon.[2]

Robert Downey, Jr. was initially going to reprise his role as Tony Stark/Iron Man in Deadpool & Wolverine, although the scene was cut when he was cast as Doctor Doom.[3]

Robert Downey, Jr. previously worked with Susan Downey in Kiss Kiss Bang Bang and Sherlock Holmes, and worked again with her Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows, The Judge and Dolittle.

Robert Downey, Jr. previously worked with Samuel L. Jackson in Hail Caesar.

Robert Downey, Jr. previously worked with Ty Burrell in Fur.

Robert Downey, Jr. previously worked with Dylan Taylor and Hope Davis in Charlie Bartlett.

Robert Downey, Jr. previously worked with Alejandro Patino in Bowfinger.

Robert Downey, Jr. previously worked with Justin Theroux and Yvette Nicole Brown in Tropic Thunder.

Robert Downey, Jr. previously worked with Mark Ruffalo in Zodiac.

Robert Downey, Jr. previously worked with Donald Li in U.S. Marshals.

Robert Downey, Jr. previously worked with Shane Black in Kiss Kiss Bang Bang.

Robert Downey, Jr. previously worked with Michael Shamus Wiles in Rented Lips.

Robert Downey, Jr. previously worked with James Spader in Tuff Turf and Less Than Zero.

Robert Downey, Jr. previously worked with Jim Rash in Love & Distrust.

Robert Downey, Jr. previously worked with Alfre Woodard in Heart and Souls and The Singing Detective.

Robert Downey, Jr. previously worked with Marisa Tomei in Chaplin and Only You.

Robert Downey, Jr. previously worked with Michael Keaton in Game 6.

Robert Downey, Jr. previously worked with Kenneth Branagh in The Gingerbread Man and worked again with him in Oppenheimer.

Robert Downey, Jr. previously worked with Benicio del Toro and Ken Jeong in All-Star Weekend.

Robert Downey, Jr. previously worked with Michael Douglas in Wonder Boys.

Robert Downey, Jr. previously worked with Florence Pugh in Oppenheimer.

Robert Downey, Jr. worked again with Jon Favreau and Scarlett Johansson in Chef.

Robert Downey, Jr. worked again with Tom Holland in Dolittle.

Robert Downey, Jr. worked again with Kenneth Branagh and James D'Arcy in Oppenheimer.

Robert Downey, Jr. worked again with Shane Black in Play Dirty.

Tony Stark's de-aged appearance in Captain America: Civil War is based on Downey's appearance in the 1987 film Less Than Zero.[4]

Robert Downey, Jr. is the husband of Susan Downey.

Robert Downey, Jr. recommended Shane Black to Marvel Studios to direct Iron Man 3.

Robert Downey, Jr. previously dated Marisa Tomei.

Robert Downey, Jr. is a producer in the DC Entertainment production Sweet Tooth.

Robert Downey, Jr. has called Guardians of the Galaxy the "best Marvel movie ever".[5]

Robert Downey, Jr. shares his birthday with Hugo Weaving and Amanda Righetti.
